definition:
Let $S$ be a groupoid (semigroup, group) and suppose
$R = \bigoplus_{s \in S}
R_{s}$ is an $S$- graded ring.

We define the [*support*]{} of $r$ to be the set
${\,{\rm supp}\,}(r) = \{ s \in S \mid
r_{s} \neq 0 \}$. We can extend this definition to
${\,{\rm supp}\,}(R) = \bigcup {\,{\rm supp}\,}R_{s} \neq 0 \}$. If
${\,{\rm supp}\,}(R)$ is a finite set then we say that the ring $R$ has
[*finite support*]{}.
